item.title: Archdaily Resume Design Contest
item.dc:creator: ankitdarda
item.description: Project details: Project Type: Online Contest Organizer: Archdaily.com Software: Photoshop Results: Due Project description: The challenge of the contest was to reinvent the traditional resume design to focused more on the design of the resume than the content itself. Your resume’s content will loudly tell about what you want to say but the overall design and organization will […]
item.content:encoded:
Project details:

Project Type: Online Contest
Organizer: Archdaily.com
Software: Photoshop
Results: Due

Project description:

The challenge of the contest was to reinvent the traditional resume design to focused more on the design of the resume than the content itself. Your resume’s content will loudly tell about what you want to say but the overall design and organization will tell what you up to. The concept behind the archdaily resume entry was to not only show the architectural personality but also the computational nerdiness. The entire resume is laid out like Revit Dynamo graph.

Concept Sketch

Enlarged Details

Dynamo Style Resume Archdaily Submission

item.title: Alexithymia
item.dc:creator: ankitdarda

Alexithymia: Inability to describe the emotion in a verbal manner. The metaphorical print relates with time and events juxtaposing the […]
item.content:encoded:
Project details:

Type: Academic
Class: PRMK 602 | Spring 2014
Professor: Eun Lee
Material: Eastern Paper, Printmaking Ink

Project description:

The Class was divided into a series of printmaking experimentation with different inks and paper techniques. Alexithymia: Inability to describe the emotion in a verbal manner. The metaphorical print relates with time and events juxtaposing the illusion of past and mystery of future.

The work is also going to publish inside Port City Review Journal at SCAD Volume III for the year 2016.

Alexithymia – I

Alexithymia Published inside Port City Review 2015

Alexithymia – II

item.title: Foreclosed Monoprint
item.dc:creator: ankitdarda
item.description: Project details: Type: Academic Class: PRMK 602 | Spring 2014 Professor: Eun Lee Material: East & West-ern Paper, Printmaking Ink, etc. Project description: The Class was divided into a series of printmaking experimentation with different inks and paper techniques. The following work belongs to the Foreclosure as theme- depicting the different spaces, layers, and memories through […]
item.content:encoded:
Project details:

Type: Academic
Class: PRMK 602 | Spring 2014
Professor: Eun Lee
Material: East & West-ern Paper, Printmaking Ink, etc.

Project description:

The Class was divided into a series of printmaking experimentation with different inks and paper techniques. The following work belongs to the Foreclosure as theme- depicting the different spaces, layers, and memories through the foreclosed houses. I used a different palette of colors and techniques across with photo transfer and monoprint mix-media as a process. The work also going to publish inside Port City Review Journal at SCAD Volume III for the year 2016.

Foreclosure Monoprint Featured inside Port City Review Journal

Foreclosed Mono – Living room with broken floor and licked walls

Foreclosed Mono – Courtyard with abandoned furniture and landscape

Foreclosed Mono – Abandoned Bedroom furniture with wall-paper

Foreclosed Mono – Ceiling with exposed rafters.

Type: Academic
Class: PRMK 602 | Spring 2014
Professor: Eun Lee
Material: East & West-ern Paper, Printmaking Ink, etc.

Project description:

The Class is divided into series of printmaking experimentation with different inks and paper techniques. These are some of the work based on monoprint technique and their evolution through the process using different colors, objects, and patterns.

item.title: Photography
item.dc:creator: ankitdarda
item.description: “Sometimes I do get to places just when God’s ready to have somebody click the shutter.” – Ansel Adams With my Nikon I have started feeling a little bit similar. “Photography: a picture painted by the sun without instruction in art.”
item.content:encoded:
“Sometimes I do get to places just when God’s ready to have somebody click the shutter.” – Ansel Adams

With my Nikon I have started feeling a little bit similar. “Photography: a picture painted by the sun without instruction in art.”

item.title: Mix Media
item.dc:creator: ankitdarda
item.description: Personal Exploration Mixed Media Art “Technique is really personality. That is the reason why the artist cannot teach it, why the pupil cannot learn it, and why the aesthetic critic can understand it. To the great poet, there is only one method of music – his own. To the great painter, there is only one […]
item.content:encoded:
Personal Exploration
Mixed Media Art

“Technique is really personality. That is the reason why the artist cannot teach it, why the pupil cannot learn it, and why the aesthetic critic can understand it. To the great poet, there is only one method of music – his own. To the great painter, there is only one manner of painting – that which he himself employs. The aesthetic critic, and the aesthetic critic alone, can appreciate all forms and all modes. It is to him that Art makes her appeal.” – Oscar Wilde.An expression of a childhood passion of portraying dreams into paintings via varied range of media of colors & techniques.

item.title: Basic Design
item.dc:creator: ankitdarda
item.description: Project Details: Type: Academic Class: Basic Design | Undergraduate Professor: Mayur Gupta Materials: MDF Board, Glass Scrap, Metal Scrap, Colors, Clay, etc. Project Description: The objective of the class was dedicated to the emergence of architectural spaces in the artistic use of different materials. The aim of such exercises was to explore most of the […]
item.content:encoded:
Project Details:

Type: Academic
Class: Basic Design | Undergraduate
Professor: Mayur Gupta
Materials: MDF Board, Glass Scrap,
Metal Scrap, Colors, Clay, etc.

Project Description:

The objective of the class was dedicated to the emergence of architectural spaces in the artistic use of different materials. The aim of such exercises was to explore most of the available materials from the mud, ceramics, stone, brick, metal, glass scrap to colors, and paper to develop the experiential qualities and think out of the box. The Metal Scrap Warrior ranked First at Zonal National Convention for Student of Architecture (NASA), Surat Chapter for on-the-spot competition.

Light Exploration

Dead Space Exploration

Light and Color Exploration

Magical Space Exploration

item.title: Architectural Ceramics
item.dc:creator: ankitdarda
item.description: Project Details: Type: Academic Class: CERA 701 | Spring 2013 Professor: Jessica Broad Material: Glazing, Clay, Wooden Frame Project Description: The Class was divided into series of architectural ceramics exploration with ceramics to develop wall and floor tiles by adopting different techniques like prototyping, extrude tiles and brick curving. The wall tile ceramic work also […]
item.content:encoded:
Project Details:

Type: Academic
Class: CERA 701 | Spring 2013
Professor: Jessica Broad
Material: Glazing, Clay, Wooden Frame

Project Description:

The Class was divided into series of architectural ceramics exploration with ceramics to develop wall and floor tiles by adopting different techniques like prototyping, extrude tiles and brick curving. The wall tile ceramic work also got Featured and Published inside Port City Review Art Journal’2014 at SCAD.

If you are looking for wood floor installation, you batter get in touch with hardwood floor installation seattle wa. Their mission at Vogel’s Carpet and Flooring is to provide our customers with the best possible service when we do any hardwood floor installation.

Extruded Architectural Ceramic Tile

Glazed Ceramic Mosaic Tile

Glazed Ceremic Tile

Wall Brick Curving
